00072 /* functions. */
00073 /* the following function tries to send
00074    the random `message' to the client. */
00075 static void
00076 handle_send (cint conn, const char *sentence)
00077 {
00078   if (send (conn, sentence, strlen (sentence), 0) < 0)
00079     log_report (LOG_ERR, "send() [server]", NULL);
00080 }

00082 /* the following function handles a connection. */
00083 static bool
00084 handle_connection (cint conn)
00085 {
00086   /* extern necessary elements. */
00087   extern char *stpcpy (char *, const char *);
00088   extern FILE *popen (const char *, const char *);
00089   extern int pclose (FILE *);
00090 
00091   /* the reading pipe edge. */
00092   FILE *pipe_stream = NULL;
00093 
00094   /* current line of chars. */
00095   char sentence[MAX_LINE] = { 0 };
00096 
00097   /* there was an error? */
00098   bool error = false;
00099 
00100   /* form the command. */
00101   stpcpy (stpcpy
00102           (stpcpy
00103            (stpcpy (comm_str, "gtrm "), fop->high_randomness ? "-r " : ""),
00104            "-i "), FILENAME_IN);
00105 
00106   /* start piping. */
00107   if ((pipe_stream = popen (comm_str, "r")) == NULL)
00108     {
00109       log_report (LOG_ERR, "popen() [server]", NULL);
00110       error = true;
00111     }
00112   else
00113     {
00114       /* get one random sentence. */
00115       if (fgets (sentence, MAX_LINE, pipe_stream) == NULL)
00116         {
00117           log_report (LOG_ERR, "fgets() [server]", NULL);
00118           error = true;
00119         }
00120       else
00121         handle_send (conn, sentence);
00122 
00123       /* close piping. */
00124       pclose (pipe_stream);
00125     }
00126 
00127   return error ? false : true;
00128 }

00131    server for `local_address' and 'port'. */
00132 bool
00133 server_run (struct in_addr local_address, uint16_t port)
00134 {
00135   /* extern necessary elements. */
00136   extern void clean_up_process (cint);
00137   extern bool log_ip_timestamp (unique, unique);
00138 
00139   /* is used for keeping server's address, port, type of socket, ... */
00140   struct sockaddr_in server_address;
00141 
00142   int server_socket;            /* is used for creating a socket. */
00143   int rval;                     /* is used for validating. */
00144 
00145   /* is used for reusing the port. */
00146   int reuse_address = 1;
00147 
00148   /* use a `SIGCHLD' handler that cleans up child processes. */
00149   signal (SIGCHLD, clean_up_process);
00150 
00151   /* try to create a tcp socket. */
00152   server_socket = socket (PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00153   if (server_socket < 0)
00154     {
00155       log_report (LOG_ERR, "socket() [server]", NULL);
00156       return false;
00157     }
00158 
00159   /* now is possible to use the same port. */
00160   rval = setsockopt (server_socket, SOL_SOCKET,
00161                      SO_REUSEADDR, &reuse_address, sizeof (reuse_address));
00162 
00163   /* what happened? */
00164   if (rval < 0)
00165     {
00166       log_report (LOG_ERR, "setsockopt() [server]", NULL);
00167       return false;
00168     }
00169 
00170   /* construct a socket address structure for the local
00171      address on which we want to listen for connections. */
00172   memset (&server_address, 0, sizeof (server_address));
00173   server_address.sin_family = AF_INET;
00174   server_address.sin_port = port;
00175   server_address.sin_addr = local_address;
00176 
00177   /* try to bind the socket to that address. */
00178   rval =
00179     bind (server_socket, (struct sockaddr *) &server_address,
00180           sizeof (server_address));
00181   if (rval < 0)
00182     {
00183       log_report (LOG_ERR, "bind() [server]", NULL);
00184       return false;
00185     }
00186 
00187   /* try to instruct the socket to accept connections. */
00188   rval = listen (server_socket, QLEN);
00189   if (rval < 0)
00190     {
00191       log_report (LOG_ERR, "listen() [server]", NULL);
00192       return false;
00193     }
00194 
00195   /* verbose mode, display the local address
00196      and the port number we're listening on. */
00197   if (fop->verbose)
00198     {
00199       socklen_t address_length = sizeof (server_address);
00200 
00201       rval = getsockname (server_socket, (struct sockaddr *)
00202                           &server_address, &address_length);
00203 
00204       if (rval == 0)
00205         syslog (LOG_INFO, "listens on %s:%d",
00206                 inet_ntoa (server_address.sin_addr),
00207                 (int) ntohs (server_address.sin_port));
00208       else
00209         log_report (LOG_ERR, "getsockname() [server]", NULL);
00210     }
00211 
00212   /* loop forever, handle any connections. */
00213   while (keep_going)
00214     {
00215       /* is used for keeping client's address, port, type of socket, ... */
00216       struct sockaddr_in client_address;
00217 
00218       socklen_t address_length; /* is used for holding the size of the address. */
00219       int conn;                 /* is used for checking accept calls. */
00220       pid_t child_pid;          /* is used for holding a process id. */
00221 
00222       address_length = sizeof (client_address);
00223 
00224       /* accept a connection. blocks until a connection is ready. */
00225       conn =
00226         accept (server_socket, (struct sockaddr *) &client_address,
00227                 &address_length);
00228 
00229       /* what happened? */
00230       if (conn < 0)
00231         {
00232           /* the call was interrupted by a signal. try again. */
00233           if (errno == EINTR)
00234             continue;
00235           else
00236             {
00237               /* something else went wrong. continue to the next accept. */
00238               log_report (LOG_ERR, "accept() [server]", NULL);
00239               continue;
00240             }
00241         }
00242 
00243       /* write ip timestamp if `-t', is on. */
00244       if (fop->ip_timestamp)
00245         {
00246           socklen_t address_length = sizeof (client_address);
00247 
00248           rval =
00249             getpeername (conn, (struct sockaddr *) &client_address,
00250                          &address_length);
00251           if (rval == 0)
00252             {
00253               /* is used for checking. */
00254               bool t_state = true;
00255 
00256               /* try to write ip timestamp. */
00257               t_state =
00258                 log_ip_timestamp (timestamp_file,
00259                                   inet_ntoa (client_address.sin_addr));
00260 
00261               /* what happened? */
00262               if (!t_state)
00263                 syslog (LOG_ERR, "log_timestamp() [server] failed to run.");
00264             }
00265           else
00266             log_report (LOG_ERR, "getpeername() [server]", NULL);
00267         }
00268 
00269       /* fork a child process to handle the connection. */
00270       child_pid = fork ();
00271 
00272       /* what happened? */
00273       if (child_pid == 0)
00274         {
00275           /* child process. */
00276 
00277           /* useless here. */
00278           close (server_socket);
00279 
00280           /* try to handle the connection. */
00281           if (!handle_connection (conn))
00282             {
00283               /* inform the administrator to fix it. */
00284               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s",
00285                       "handle_connection() [server] failed to run.");
00286               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", " ");
00287               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", check_follow);
00288               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", gtrm_problem);
00289               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", path_problem);
00290               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", file_problem);
00291               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", eof_problem);
00292               syslog (LOG_ERR, "%s", " ");
00293             }
00294 
00295           /* no more useful. */
00296           close (conn);
00297 
00298           /* terminate the child process. */
00299           _exit (EXIT_SUCCESS);
00300         }
00301       else if (child_pid > 0)
00302         {
00303           /* parent process. */
00304           close (conn);
00305         }
00306       else
00307         {
00308           /* fork failed. */
00309           log_report (LOG_ERR, "fork() [server]", NULL);
00310         }
00311     }
00312 
00313   /* server stopped due to `SIGTERM' signal. */
00314   return true;
00315 }
